intro: Mormolyca rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed mormolyca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
